enhanced_by.reason: Both methods involve inserting HTML content relative to the matched elements, with 'after' inserting after and 'before' inserting before.
Both methods involve adding HTML content to elements, with 'after' adding outside and 'append' adding inside the closing tag.
The 'after' method modifies the outer HTML of elements, and 'outerHtml' retrieves the outer HTML, making it useful for assertions on the modified state.
The 'toString' method, which is an alias for 'outerHtml', can be used to assert the state of the elements after the 'after' method has been applied.
